Reviews.Title: “Older property, Lack of Customer Service and unfriendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: buzzlightyear12
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Miam and had a bad experience staying at this Courtyard! - Internet wouldn't work in the room. When I called the front desk, it took 3 attempts before anybody picked up the phone. When informed of the internet problem, they sent a 65-year person (Hernandez) who is responsible for maintenance to fix the internet issue. He had no clue of what the technical problem was and returned without any resolution. I had to call the front desk again and after 1.5 hour they reset the servers/routers which allowed for internet access to work. - There is a stinking smell in the hotel (room and hallway) like they have sprayed some detergent or carpet deodorant. It is disgusting. I am not sure if they change the bedsheets after each guest checks out. The reason I say this is because the beds are itchy, sheets felt used and worn out, and kept me up most of the 2 nites I stayed here. I am never coming back to this property again!!! - I had a business dinner I had to attend on the 1st day. I wanted to take a shower before heading out. There was no hot water in the bathroom. The front desk asked me to let the water run for 5 minutes. I did that for 15 minutes and the best I got was lukewarm water. The maintenance staff told me that they turn down the water heaters in the afternoon and they will turn it back again to heat up the water. That was just unheard of and very disappointing. I was significantly delayed for dinner! - The staff at the front desk is very unresponsive and unfriendly. I requested for a cab. They told me that the cab would arrive in 10 minutes. I waited for 25 minutes and requested the staff to call the cab company again. The lady (jenny at the front desk) told me that I just had to be patient. The cab didn't come for 40 minutes and it was unfortunate that Jenny didn't see the urgency to call the cab company again! - This property doesn't provide water bottles or in-room mini fridge where you can buy beverages. I called the front desk if I can get a water bottle since I was thirsty and it was 10pm at night. The gentleman at the front desk indicated to me that he would send a water bottle, but they would charge me a couple of bucks on my hotel bill. I told them that it was not a problem. 20 minutes goes by and there is no water bottle. I called them again and this time Jenny picks up the phone. I asked her on the status of the request. She tells me that they made a mistake and they were not planning to send any water because it was not their responsibility. I told her that other gentleman had informed me that he would send the water and charge me for it which was fine by me. She became rude with her responses and basically indicated that the other gentleman made a mistake and I would have to just get my own water bottle myself. I felt that this was not very customer-friendly response and the staff didn't follow up after they made a service committment. After all, I was not asking anything for free. If they had told me upfront that they wouldn't do it, then I would have planned for other option. Anyway, I went to sleep without drinking any water that night. In my opinion, Jenny is not meant to be in the hospitality business. Bottomline - I am not visiting this property in Miami. Fairly disappointed with this property and the service that its staff provides!

Reviews.Title: “nice home base”
Reviews.Author: Margaret J
Reviews.Content: We were in Miami for a wedding and stayed here with other wedding guests. Everyone we had contact with went out of their way to be helpful. The rooms were well maintained. The breakfast was good. The young man taking care of the breakfast area was outstanding. The front desk people were excellent. We had people coming and going all weekend and they stayed on top of it all. For us, this Courtyard was perfect as our home base while attending the wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: traveler10173
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came back again for his work, and the place wasn't quite as nice as I remembered. The room is still decorated nicely and is spacious. The staff is very friendly and courteous, which is one of the better points. The gym is also great. The downsides would be that this time we got a room near the road. It was on a higher floor but I could still hear road noise during the day. The evenings were ok though. I didn't hear anyone next door though. The bed seems like it needs replacing soon, as well as the towels. The pool was heated and nice although it is small, surrounded by brick and beyond it is the road, so not exactly super relaxing. The hot tub was under construction too which was disappointing. The breakfast for $12 was not very good either, although they did have a lot of food options.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Keleye
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 nights with my husband and 2 year old. This was a pretty central location for us since we have family all over the Miami area. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious. They do have a breakfast buffet in the morning but we didnt use it. There is a Publix grocery store across the street which was perfect for a cheaper breakfast option and to have snacks in the room. The hotel has a small pool area. The valet was kind of a mess. Leaving our car at night with valet, means leaving your car in the middle of the street until they can find space to move it. Staff and housekeeping were very nice. My room was a standard King bedroom. The beds are comfortable and the room was a decent yet standard size. The Dadeland mall, Starbucks, Old Navy and the I-826 (Palmetto) freeway are just a couple blocks away, There are also restaurants such as a Chili's, a pizza place and Mexican restaurant right off SW88th and SW72nd. (a few blocks). Plus restaurants such as Cheesecake Factory inside the mall. With rush hour traffic, it was about a 20-25 minute drive from the Miami airport to the hotel. If you drive from the hotel towards Miami Beach or Coral Gables..etc, be prepared to be in a lot of traffic on the Dixie Hwy. There is so much traffic and so many stop lights. Its a little frustrating. All in all, I liked staying here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard at Miami Dadeland”
Reviews.Author: lone6star
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here regularly throughout 2011. Was surprised to see the negative comments from others about this hotel. I have never experienced any of these incidences. The hotel is a high quality establishment and meets the Marriott standards. Breakfast is not free, but it can be worked into your daily rate. I don't rent a car, as I can walk to the office. All my trips here are for business. There is a Publix supermarket across the street, as well as many restaurants within walking distance. I've reviewed several of these as well.. Rooms are quite spacious and include a flat screen TV. Recently during the NFL season, they provide Free popcorn during the night games. Staff is very friendly and go out of their way to assist you. Across the street is the Dadeland Mall, and the hotel provides a free shuttle service here, as well as to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Bland.... a jail cell with the sliding glass door and a balcony.”
Reviews.Author: Rick-Gee3
Reviews.Content: I spend over 200 nights a year in hotels. As a Marriott Platinum Elite member with close to 100 nights in the Marriott line this year this would have to be my most disappointing stay thus far. Most Courtyards give Platinum members a complementary voucher for breakfast. Not this one! When my wife and I laid down for the nigh to watch a little TV before retiring, we turned it on and sound but no picture. Called the front desk they offered to move us or send up a technician, we opted for the latter, but we both had to get dressed again to receive the tech. (he go it fixed) The bed was like sleeping on the boxsprings (stiff as a board). The toilet tissuewas the cheapest I have ever seen anywhere. The coffee at the coffee station in the lobby was cool at best, with no half and half. I had to request hot coffee & the half and half fro,m the front desk. Oh, and let's not forget....no parking, except for $12 a night valet which required a half hour wait to get your car back, then an open hand wanting a tip.... I will not use this Courtyard again, but maybe try the Marriott across the street. They get $200 and up for a room, I wouldn't give $49... Better yet try the Dadeland Hampton Inn around the corner. Better beds, free breakfast an free parking with no waiting...

Reviews.Title: “Waste of time.”
Reviews.Author: Lee G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard for a total of 5 weeks and it was 5 weeks of missery. I was told to move room 3 times as they had an ant infestation which would not go away. The room was not cleaned until around 3pm and when your there to relax you dont want to be kicked out of your room. The people on the front desk were nice for the most part if not overly helpful. When ever i requested something they always seemed to roll there eyes as if to say it was not their JOB. Over all I would never go back to this hotel and I would never recomend for anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good one”
Reviews.Author: ypwalter
Reviews.Content: 1. I asked if there is any free breakfast, and got a answer of "yes, we have breakfast in morning". However, it is NOT FREE, and was charged 12USD that comparing to other same level hotels, it's not worth it. (Holiday Inn does a better job) 2. There was mosquitoes(and bed bugs) in the room that bit me. Also, I suspect there is bed bug because after I left the hotel, my body had certain bad reaction that reacted only to the bed bugs.(I can recognize the bites between bed bugs and mosquitoes due to my special body reactions) 3. I doesn't feel good while in this hotel for some reason, I should have chosen other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: eastmagicmountainman
Reviews.Content: My stay at Marriott's Courtyard Miami Dadeland Inn was pleasant, the price reasonable, and it was conveniently located, just across the street from the more expensive Marriott Hotel, the HQ for my high school's 50th reunion; also, it was only two blocks from the Dadeland Mall, one block from Publix Super-Market, one block from "Shorty's," which, quite simply, is the greatest bar-b-q place in South Florida! Also, the neighborhood contains several other interesting ethnic restaurants. The staff were friendly, competent and helpful. (e.g. they provided some scotch tape, to help me mend the cover of the paperback I was reading--Moby Dick--when I had unintentionally ripped it while pulling it out of my back-pack; also, via phone, they provided directions on how to get to the hotel by public transportation, and, once there, provided me with a map of Miami's public transit system; hence, I was able to take Miami's high speed elevated rail system from and to Miami's Amtrak station, thus avoiding a $60 to $70 cab fare each way!). There in-house breakfast buffet was good. Another friend and I had a wonderful, leisurely brunch the final morning of our 50th anniversary reunion. My only complaint? The dozen or so computers available to hotel guests in the lobby were in sad shape. I couldn't even get into my e-mails, let alone send any, without trying half-a-dozen before finding one which was operational. Then again, like everyone else these days, I should have brought my own lap-top (but wanted to travel light). All-in-all, though, a pleasant *** with wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but those ac units!”
Reviews.Author: mmerc2004
Reviews.Content: Love the Marriott chain in general - Courtyard, Fairfield, Residence Inns - love them all. I can always count on a good room in a convenient place at a decent price. This was a very nice hotel and room - just a notch above the average Courtyard in a convenient Dadeland Mall area. Close to restaurants and shopping. Only two downsides - parking and the AC unit. Parking is limited to valet only. You can likely take a spot at one of the garages, but when you check in at 1130p at night, I'm not hunting for a garage. But this means that you have to call down well in advance to have your car ready to go. When you're pressing for time in getting to a morning meeting, factor in HEAVY traffic in the area (particularly northbound on the Dixie Hwy) and the wait to get your car. Almost cost us getting to our 9am meeting. And why do major hotel chains get these cheap, loud wall units and put them in an otherwise perfect room? Anyone who travels for a living has dealt with this problem - the compressor turns on and its so loud that it breaks your sleep cycle. That made for two very uncomfortable nights. Absolutely nothing the front desk can do - this is just the nature of these kinds of units. Just very 2 * infrastructure in a 3* property. Marriott - don't cheap out on us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: travelover_sp
Reviews.Content: Far from downtown but Publix, Dadeland Mall and Metrorail located very next to the hotel. Nice staffs. The only problem was valet parking. It took so long to bring your car.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for getting ripped off on the rate quoted and what they charge you - seemed fishy.”
Reviews.Author: FreqBizTraveler34
Reviews.Content: Requested a day rate as I had a few hours to kill before a late afternoon meeting nearby. The front desk clerk quoted me a rate of half the full day rate. I agreed and checked in. When leaving the hotel a few hours later, I was informed that I would need to pay the full day rate. After trying to reason with the clerk, the imbecile Operations Director further refused to honor the rate I had been quoted. The clerk then changed his story to say that the rate he offered me was only "conditional" on the managers approval (probably fearing he was going to be fired). What a joke. For a rate difference of $60 he allowed me to leave the hotel seething and for sure never coming back. What a pity as it was very convenient to a place I will need to visit frequently, but fortunately there are plenty of others to choose from at the same price....

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Freizeitmokel
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for biz. Only Valet parking what makes it a bit expensive but other than that it's a nice place to stay. Close to many restaurants and a nice mall in walking distance. The staff was just terrific at this place. Breakfast buffet was normal standard. Very close to the public train system.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, sparking clean, smiling staff, great breakfast and well located.”
Reviews.Author: Visit-upstate-NY
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here because it was central to the golf courses that we play and within walking distance of a Publix grocery and several restaurants. Rooms were quiet. The hotel is spotless, nearly new and staffed by friendly people. No on site parking, valet only at $11/day, but they delivered the car quickly to the front door and the car can be retrieved multiple times with no additional fee (tip of course). Breakfast buffet was $10 and worth the price. Exercise room was small as was the hot tub, but these are minor issues. We look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great.”
Reviews.Author: Kafi31
Reviews.Content: Just got back to Trinidad from my holiday in Miami. This hotel is awesome. The staff was friendly, courteous, patient. The hotel is clean, spacious. Had no problems! The area is close to shopping & restaurants. Theres even a large market right nx door. I highly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Served as a great base for exploring Miami.”
Reviews.Author: Cube44
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with my wife and our 2-year old daughter. First and foremost, the staff were very pleasant, gracious, and accommodating. I asked one of the housekeepers for an extra bottle of shampoo, and when she saw that I was staying there with my daughter, she promtly loaded me up with shampoos, soaps, lotions, and even a few extra towels. Very nice! The parking situation is a bit laughable at times; just be aware that you're pretty much stuck with the valet parking prices, and thanks to the VERY limited availability, you'll be leaving your car in a jumbled mess, near the hotel's entrance if you return late in the evening. The parking attendants were very good about explaining the situation, though. I understand the area, and the fact that their hands were tied. Hey, what can ya do? They clear the cars as soon as space became available, so no complaints. The hotel itself was fine. Clean and spacious common areas, Small and efficient excercise room and pool. The property is situated across the street from a Publix grocery store, which was big, clean, and seemed to cater to the residents of the surrounding high-rise condos. A tip: SKIP THE HOTEL BREAKFAST. The Publix offers a variety of fresh pastries, a sit-down cafe', deli, and even a little booth which sells some great -tasting (and REALLY CHEAP) Cuban coffee. The hotel is about a block away from SW 88th St. which offers a variety of dining and shopping options, including the HUGE MALL. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The bathroom was spacious, with enough vanity/counter space to accommodate my wife's seemingly endless amount of cosmetics. Though we did not have much of a view from our room, aside from the Publix parking lot, we were able to focus more on what was happening inside the room. Which we truly enjoyed. Let's get something straight: This is NOT a resort. What you're paying for is the convenient location. The pool is small, as is the exercise room, which in my opion, are just fine. If you're looking for a clean, conveniently located, and spacious place to use as a base while you explore Miami, you can't go wrong here. It's not the Ritz, but the staff, clean spaces, and location made our stay very enjoyable. Kudos!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelweeklyforwork2
Reviews.Content: The courtyard is a great hotel - spotlessly clean and the staff are very professional. The only reasons that I wouldnt give it five stars is due to the valet parking (just a personal preference for hotels with self parking) and the noise that can sometimes occur from the location of the hotel (it is surrounded by tall buildings so noise from other garages etc can be annoying if car alarms go off). I would definitely stay here again - you can walk to Dadeland mall and metrorail.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Caymangirl8
Reviews.Content: I loved my one night stay. Normally I stay across the road at the Dadeland Marriott, (must have stayed there more than two dozen nights (including a whole week) over the last 3 years, always with son or husband or both) but because I was travelling alone this time, and breakfast was included, in the great room rate of $101, I decided to try the Courtyard. I was not at all disappointed....rooms actually larger than the Dadeland M standard king/ 2 queen rooms, or at least have more free floor space. Comfortable king-size bed, (loads of pillows) comfortable couch, usable coffee table, usable desk and a connection box in front of the large swivel mounted TV where my IPod plugged in...There was an empty working fridge, great for the few things bought from the next door Publix.. Wireless internet connection in the room made using Skype from my ITouch very easy and best of all FREE. Ironing board and iron in the closet. No in room safe though. The bathroom, was roomy, spotless (and I am a clean freak) with loads of towels. (They did have a chlorex odour, (as in a previous post) but faint so it was not that bad, and at least proved they were clean???). The shower was powerful and there was plenty of hot water. I am short so managed a nice soak in the tub, but would not be much of a soak for anyone tall. There was a slight stale smell in the room when I arrived (no problem at all with an early check in at 11am), but when I mentioned it to the head housekeeper, (I met in her by chance in the corridor), she was very sympathtic and I think the carpet was given a shampoo while I was out, certainly the room did not smell stale when I got back about 5 hours later . The front desk staff were bright and helpful and welcoming, replacing a broken hair drier in a few minutes, and when my keycard didn't work in the door, someone was there to help before I got back from reporting it on the corridor phone...(of course the key then worked first time). (Apart from stale smell...minor points) The free breakfast was much better than I expected, with a choice of cereals, fruit, pastries, sausages, bacon, and a chef preparing eggs to order, there were waffles, toast (toaster took ages though) and hot oats etc. Even so if I had to pay it would only have been $13...very good value. Not as extensive as some places, but definitely 100% better than say a Comfort Inn style buffet breakfast. In the lobby were two large fridges, one stocked with beverages (including beer) and one with things like prepared sandwiches and salads...also trays of snack type foods - help yourself and pay at reception. There was also complimentary coffee, tea and iced tea in the lobby and use of a microwave. I like this area, because the Dadeland Mall is about 5 mins walk away (JC Penny, Macys, Saks and Nordstrom as anchors). There is a Metro station practically in the Dadeland Marriott and one stop away is Bed Bath and Beyond, Target and Best Buy Superstores (plus Sports Authority and Michaels) . (Metro now with a $5 all day ticket, great because can go back and forth the one stop and save having to pay $2 each way!!!). Across the highway are some others large stores like Payless, Borders etc. all within walking distance. The Free airport shuttle (serves both Marriotts) will drop off and pick up from the mall (great if you are laden with tired feet). Now the same shuttle even does a run to the Dolphin Mall for $15 return... I would happily have stayed for the week, and will definitely stay there the next time I need some retail therapy.... The staff service in both hotels: I always had excellent service and a cheery "welcome back" at the Dadeland M I could not choose between the staff, at the Courtyard the staff equaled the DM, but for value the Courtyard wins hands down.....I will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for South Miami Traveler”
Reviews.Author: FTBoomer
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to do business at the University of Miami for several months now. I've been staying at this Courtyard the entire time. The staff are incredibly efficient and friendly. Everyone from the service staff, Rene and Ana in the restaurant, Pier the Valet and Tina and Norma and the others in reception go the extra step to ensure that I have everything I needed in an efficient and timely manner. My only gripe would be that the internet in the room is wired and slow (by today's standards). Other than that, I have nothing but praise for this hotel and it's staff. You know, reading back over this, I realized that this is just a regular Courtyard hotel and while there certainly isn't anything wrong with that, it's the staff that makes this hotel more than JUST a Courtyard. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “I hated it. Every day a little more”
Reviews.Author: PutAGoodSpin
Reviews.Content: I checked in at 1:00 AM, it was rather late, and we were tired, but the front desk seemed to be more willing to chitchat with the office girl rather than have us check-in. After they finished their lovy-dovy talks, we were asked for, checked-in. The carpet smelled a little. The bath towels had strong clorox odor. The valet parking in this hotel sucks. They take too much time to get teh car our and at times the front desk forgets to ask valet or the valet forgets even if front desk asks them to. But ofcourse no one will apologise or anything for wasting your time. Its a big inconvenience if you plan to stay for more than a day or two, believe me. I met the worst front desk pople at this hotel. They are not courteous, not polite and are straight faced so much that it is almost rude, but i guess it could be me since i have never stayed in a hotel where the front desk didnt greet you smilingly or didn't take care of your problems at the earliest. The iron and the iron board looked like ones from school dorm and i feared for my clothes. They replace 2 irons the latter was worse. When i got theird iron, they didn't botehr to take the previous two away, the neatly arranged those crappy irons on TV desk for my view...soothing...isn't it? I have stayed in hotels across country, this probably was the poorest courtyard marriot experience ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid..for now”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo52
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel until it renews facilities and improves service. Good location but it looks a bit rundown and not up to the standards of a Courtyard. Elevator needs maintenance. In room, alarm clock and coffee maker did not work and maintenance could only offer to replace them next day. Valet parking not bad for $11a night but asked every time about probable next use of car. Room not cleaned at 4:00 pm even though hotel did not look to be that busy. Internet connection not reliable. No room service and breakfast not included. You can get much better deals in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful entering into any contracts with Miami Courtyard Dadelnad”
Reviews.Author: baseltj
Reviews.Content: I was not treated fairly. They told me one thing made me sign a contract and then stuck it to me. Bad arrogant people. Very difficult to understand and deal with. The neighborhood is a mess with construction dust everywhere and questionable workers walking around. I would stay away from here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms -- internet and parking was a problem...”
Reviews.Author: RedskinsRule
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 week on a business trip. The rooms are very well done. Flat screen TV, VERY comfortable bed, clean, overall great. However, there were a few problems. First, their internet was down for over a day. I had to find a Kinko's and print a business report I had to have first thing in the morning. They did not pick up the Kinko's tab. Second, the parking situation is HORRIBLE. You have to use valet which is $10 per day. Your only other option is to park at the grocery store behind the hotel and down the road. Now that I think about it, I should have done the latter more often because the valet took forever to bring my car. One evening, I needed the car to drive to the Cheesecake factory and I stood there for close to 20 minutes waiting for my car before I finally gave up and walked there. The next morning, I found my car parked at the curb so it did eventually get there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sawinn
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard seems to be a "step up" from the other Courtyard hotels I stayed at in the past. It has a nice spacious lobby, clean rooms, and a decent breakfast. I stayed in a corner suite which was very large and spacious. It had most of the amenities I would have expected in a mid-grade hotel suite. My only complaint would be the pillows, they were very uncomfortable. One of my co-workers had a standard King and said the room was "on-par" with other mid-grade hotels. Besides the pillows from hell, the only issues we encountered were slow elevators and a long wait for the valet (we should have called down). The hotel is located across the street from a full service Marriott and the Miami Dadeland Mall. The hotel is also approx. 5 minutes from U of M and 15 minutes from the airport. Overall, I would recommend the hotel for business travelers and visitors looking for decent hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Safe”
Reviews.Author: cbufis
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is newer, clean, and the staff was great. The only issue was the drive into Miami. It was only 11 miles but traffic on the Dixie Highway sometimes created a 30 minute drive. The Hotel has no parking but they have excellent Valets for $10.00 per day. The area is nice with a Mall and a Grocery Store within 1/2 a block. You can feel safe between this location and Miami Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Just like all Marriott's!”
Reviews.Author: BakerBoysGirl
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one day due to a Christmas party on this coast. Check in was quick, they upgraded us to a king size suite, which was nice with it's little living room and desk. Beds were great, room very clean. The only thing I wish they would change is the bathroom. Our's was large, but it had a narrow bathtub and hubby is a big football type guy. It was quite funny with him wrestling with the plastic sheet stuck to his body. Marriottt....please, please update your bathrooms to have a large shower stall !!! We did not have breakfast there, since we had plans elsewhere. Check-out was quick and great. No annoying maids bamming on your door at 7:00 am either. Staff seemed very well trained, and spoke very good English, even the late night staff. Yes, there is no on site parking. All the web sites for this hotel tell you that. But, it was fairly priced at $10, and the valet service was quick. Miami parking for $10.00 is a steal ! Trust me! Overall, a great stay. Dadeland mall is right around the corner, Dixe Highway is right around the corner....great location, great hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mscjudo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and really liked the hotel. The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable with many pillows and a down comforter. I also liked how there was a nice sized ledge in the bathtub for all of my toiletries, b/c I was sharing the room with 2 other people and need the extra space. The hotel was only 4 stories which meant you never had to wait very long for the elevator! The lobby of the hotel has like 4 computers with free internet access which is the most I've ever seen available at a hotel. The price was reasonable for a Marriott. The area around the hotel is safe and nice. The Dadeland Mall is within walking distance and it hosts several nice restaurants. I'd be happy to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok - had problems, they tired to fix”
Reviews.Author: SteveMavsFan
Reviews.Content: The day I was going to check in I call in the morning to confirm the airport shuttle, I tell the lady who answered that I am landing tonight and need to find out about the shuttle. She tells me it leaves the hotel every hour on the hour so just call after I get my luggage and they will tell me where to meet it. When I get my luggage about 10:30pm I call and they tell me the last shuttle leaves the airport at 9:30 and I will have to find my own way to the hotel. I get transfered the Courtyard front desk after disputing this and they tell me to take a cab. I say "And you will reimburse the taxi cost, right?" She thought about it and said yes. So they took care of that but still a hassle I did not want. So I get the hotel and ask "Where can I get some food at this hour?" She says no where really, but say some fast food might be open a 10 min walk away. I hike it the place get some food and come back and see in the lobby some sandwiches, pasta, salads, etc. She failed to mention any of this and let me walk to get my food. The room was ok, little noisy. Fairly clean and good sized. Free internet. I did expect much more for the price though. The staff did not seem too interested in my needs either. Some days I got a paper, others not. So it was just ok but for the price it was a negative stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Melissaif
Reviews.Content: The location was certainly good and rooms were a nice size. What they didn't tell me is that their "free airport shuttle" meant I might have to wait 3 hours at the airport, even though the hotel is less than 10 miles away. Check with them before you travel to find out how long you might have to wait. Friends of mine were given keys to dirty hotel rooms TWICE, but then compensated with the very nice, $9-12 breakfast buffet. There was a language barrier with some staff, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat, New in 2004!”
Reviews.Author: roadweary
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This Courtyard opened in late 2004, and it's awesome! It's still a little pricey, but if you don't mind paying a little extra, you'll be rewarded! I love the new design work by Marriott. Updated colors, fabrics, furnishings, you name it. I especially like the high speed access (it's free) in the rooms, as well as several computer workstations downstairs in the lobby area. Nice restraunt area with above average fare. Workout facility is small but well equipped by today's standards (has a dumbell "rack"). Valet parking- I think it was $6. Rooms are excellent. If you catch a break, you might even get upgraded to a room with a walk-in shower and two-person whirlpool tub! Great spot- walk to Publix next door, or the Dadeland Mall.
